node.title: Every morning Andrew woke to the sound of his cellmate on the toilet
node.alt: A man in a black hoodie looks to the left as he poses in front of a graffiti wall
node.description: Prisoners are forced to use the toilet in front of cellmates, a new report says, because the Tasmanian government is dealing with growing numbers by adding beds to single cells not designed for them.Â
node.content:
["Andrew Greeley knows better than most what it is like to crave privacy and space.", "\"[In prison]\u00a0you're in a cell with another person. The toilet's in the cell, the shower's in the cell. It's very dehumanising. It's punishment, that's for sure,\" he said.", "\"Every morning I woke up to the sound of my cellmate taking a shit.\"", "Mr Greeley was released from\u00a0Tasmania's Risdon Prison in January 2020\u00a0after serving a nine-month sentence for grievous bodily harm.", "He spent a lot of that time in a single cell, but\u00a0he was not alone. An extra bunk and cellmate had been added.", "'It's a two by four-metre cell so \u2026 you've got enough room to be able to pace the four metres while the other cellmate lies in his bed.\u00a0", "\"You can't really be both standing in there at the same time unless one is in the shower.\u00a0", "Mr Greeley said he did eventually find himself on his own in a single cell.", "\"It was a big relief when I was finally able to comfortably sit in a small cell by myself,\" he said.", "\"By the time you get your own cell you think, 'This is glorious.'\"", "If this sounds normal, it is not, or at least it should not be, according to Tasmania's custodial inspector Richard Connock.", "", "
The report found that most of the temporary beds were \"effectively permanent\".(Supplied)
", "His latest report found the prison was\u00a0coping with growing prisoner numbers by adding \"temporary\" beds to cells, but the beds had\u00a0not proven to be temporary.", "It\u00a0counted 85 beds classified by the Tasmanian Prison Service (TPS) as temporary that had been in daily use since January.", "\"Temporary beds are either mattresses placed on floors or beds installed in bunk-bed or single-bed configurations in cells,\" he wrote.", "\"The majority of 'temporary' beds are effectively permanent bed installations.\"", "Mr Connock said the designation of the beds as temporary, excluding them from the prison's calculation of operational capacity, indicated that the TPS\u00a0was not providing the staff and services to cater for the additional prisoner numbers in its custodial centres.", "Staff shortages are often cited as a major cause of prison lockdowns.", "\"Lockdowns may be implemented for a number of reasons and my [previous]\u00a0report has shown that staff resourcing is the second most common reason that lockdowns are implemented,\" he said.", "
'Broader human rights' not regarded
", "", "
The report said converting single cells to house\u00a0more prisoners impacted on prisoners'\u00a0privacy and dignity.(ABC News: David Fraser)
", "Mr Connock also found most prison cells at the five custodial centres did not meet the Australian standard for single and double cells with washing areas.", "For those sharing cells that were designed to be single, it meant being forced to go to the toilet in front of other prisoners, and while the showers were partially screened, the space was minimal.\u00a0", "\"In some cases where cells have been fitted with bunk beds, it is impossible to contain water from the shower, with the cell floor easily wet and in some cases flooded,\" he said.", "Mr Connock said the crowded spaces made it difficult to \"fully accommodate the sleeping and relaxation needs of prisoners in a shared cell environment\" and they were not compensated with any extra time out of their cells.", "\"While prisoners may agree \u2026\u00a0to be accommodated with other prisoners their decisions are predominantly based on safety and relationship\u00a0considerations without regard to broader human rights, privacy and physical and mental health issues,\" he wrote.", "
Overcrowding hurting rehab prospects
", "University of Tasmania criminologist Vicky Nagy said the report was unacceptable but unsurprising.", "\"This is something that's happening around the world, especially in places that are trying to solve crime and social problems by incarcerating people,\" said Dr Nagy.", "\"Instead of trying to solve mental health problems outside the prison,\u00a0instead of supporting people with homes, employment, education, a lot of the times those failures result in vulnerable individuals ending up in prison.", "", "
Critics of the prison service say unrest at Risdon in May was promoted by cell overcrowding.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "Dr Nagy said COVID-19 lockdowns were a \"great indicator\" of what happens when people are locked up together in small spaces.", "\"For a lot of people that caused a lot of stress, anxiety, that they were constantly up in everyone else's space,\" she said.", "\"Imagine the space that you're in is much smaller. It's a cell, it's only supposed to be big enough for one person and you're sharing that very small space.", "She said for prisoners, this could have a negative impact on their rehabilitation prospects.", "Tasmania has one of the highest recidivism rates in the country, at 47 per cent.", "\"Overcrowding has the impact that you have a limited number of staff \u2026 so you don't have time with the individual that requires that service,\" she said.", "\"That's obviously detrimental to the person that's incarcerated because they're not getting the full treatment that they necessarily need. It's more of a box-ticking exercise.", "
Changes addressing issues, minister says
", "", "
The government says five of seven recommendations are being addressed.\u00a0(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "Responding to the review, Corrections Minister Elise Archer said five of Mr Connock's seven recommendations were already being addressed through existing initiatives.", "She also said the inspection on which the review was based was conducted in January and several changes had\u00a0occurred since then.", "\"A number of strategies have also been developed to enable the TPS to effectively manage capacity pressures,\" she said.", "\"This includes the installation of a number of temporary surge beds and the phased introduction of a dedicated Vacancy Management Unit to oversee the assignment of prisoners to accommodation.\"", "She said the prison being built in the state's north would accommodate 270\u00a0prisoners and remandees, giving the\u00a0TPS \"greater capacity and operational flexibility.\"\u00a0"]
